0:
--------------------
Text: The Titular Patriarch of the East Indies (Latin: "Patriarcha Indiarum Orientalium" ; "Patriarchatus Indiarum Orientalium" for Titular Patriarchate of the East Indies) in the Catholic hierarchy is the title of the Archbishop of Goa and Daman in India; another title of his is that of the Primate of the East.

Triplets:
<The Titular Patriarch
1:
--------------------
Text: Patriarch of the East Indies:  Unlike the patriarchs and the major archbishops of the Eastern Catholic Churches "sui juris", the Patriarch of the East Indies only enjoys honorary title and is fully subject to the pope.
Triplets:<Patriarch of the East Indies
2:
--------------------
Text: Patriarch of the East Indies:  He has a place within the Latin Church similar to the Patriarchs of Venice and Lisbon.

Triplets:
<Patriarch of the East Indies
3: The Patriarch of the East Indies

--------------------
Text: Patriarch of the East Indies:  The Patriarch of the East Indies is the diocesan ordinary of the Archdiocese of Goa and Daman and the metropolitan archbishop of the Province of Goa and Daman
Triplets:<The Patriarch of the East Indies
The Patriarch of the East Indies
